result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy R Lochowicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Submit to Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.

No contact with Walmart.
No contact with L.B.

records.addlTxt: Review/Modification Requested/Recommended from Department of Corrections.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Timothy R Lochowicz in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court passes matter for parties to clarify offer.  Case recalled at 3:01.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1, 2 and 4 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:

Count 3:
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 1 year) CONSECUTIVE to 15CF331.  STAYED.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $253.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Restitution of $308.97 to be paid to Walmart as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week and continue to have a sponsor.  No contact with Walmart.  No contact with L.B.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school after treatment is well established.
